section.para:
The ngx_http_oidc_module module (1.27.4) implements authentication as a Relying Party in OpenID Connect using the
Authorization Code Flow.

The module expects the OpenID Provider's configuration to be available via
metadata and requires dynamic resolver.

The module can be combined with other access modules via the directive. Note that the module may still block requests even with satisfy any; as an OpenID Provider might not redirect the user back to nginx.

para.note: This module is available as part of our commercial subscription.

section.name: Example Configuration

directive.name: oidc_provider
directive.para: Defines an OpenID Provider for use with the directive.

directive.name: auth_oidc
directive.para: Enables end user authentication with the specified OpenID Provider.
Parameter value can contain variables (1.29.0).
The special value off cancels the effect of the auth_oidc directive inherited from the previous configuration level.

directive.name: issuer
directive.para: Sets the Issuer Identifier URL of the OpenID Provider; required directive. The URL must exactly match the value of “issuer” in the OpenID Provider metadata and requires the “https” scheme.

directive.name: client_id
directive.para: Specifies the client ID of the Relying Party; required directive.

directive.name: client_secret
directive.para: Specifies a secret value used to authenticate the Relying Party with the OpenID Provider. The supported authentication methods are client_secret_basic and client_secret_post (1.29.3). The method is selected based on the OpenID Provider metadata with a preference to client_secret_basic.

directive.name: config_url
directive.para: Sets a custom URL to retrieve the OpenID Provider metadata.

directive.name: cookie_name
directive.para: Sets the name of a session cookie.

directive.name: extra_auth_args
directive.para:
Sets additional query arguments for the authentication request URL.
extra_auth_args "display=page&prompt=login";

directive.name: frontchannel_logout_uri
directive.para: Defines the URI path for triggering front-channel logout. For the logout request to be associated with a user session, it must either include the module session cookie or provide both the “iss” and “sid” arguments. It is recommended to configure the OpenID Provider to set the “iss” and “sid” arguments when invoking this endpoint.

directive.name: pkce
directive.para: Explicitly enables or disables PKCE. By default, PKCE is automatically enabled based on OpenID Provider metadata.

directive.name: redirect_uri
directive.para: Defines the Redirection URI path for post-authentication redirects expected by the module from the OpenID Provider. The uri must match the configuration on the Provider's side.
Absolute “https” URIs are supported since 1.29.0.

directive.name: logout_uri
directive.para: Defines the URI path for initiating session logout. Upon session termination, the user is redirected to Provider's Logout Endpoint or to the post logout page. If neither is configured, the built-in post logout page is displayed.

directive.name: post_logout_uri
logout_token_hint
directive.para: Adds the id_token_hint argument to the Provider's Logout Endpoint when redirecting user during logout. This argument can be required by some OpenID Providers.

directive.name: scope
directive.para: Sets requested scopes. The openid scope is always required by OIDC.

directive.name: session_store
directive.para:
Specifies a custom key-value database that stores session data. By default, an 8-megabyte key-value database named oidc_default_store_<provider name> is created automatically.
A separate key-value database should be configured for each Provider to prevent session reuse across providers.

directive.name: session_timeout
directive.para: Sets a timeout after which the session is deleted, unless it was refreshed.

directive.name: ssl_crl
directive.para: Specifies a file with revoked certificates (CRL) in the PEM format used to verify the certificates of the OpenID Provider endpoints.

directive.name: ssl_trusted_certificate
directive.para: Specifies a file with trusted CA certificates in the PEM format used to verify the certificates of the OpenID Provider endpoints.

directive.name: userinfo
directive.para: Enables downloading of the UserInfo data and makes UserInfo claims available via the $oidc_claim_name variables.
